result.execSummary:
The defendant David D. Cole was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receiving Stolen Property (>$10,000) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: 14CF58 & any other existing sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Court orders the fines, costs, and restitution in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy, not to exceed 25% of gross during the term of initial confinement. If any fines, costs, and/or restitution remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. The defendant is to have NO CONTACT with Jorgies', The Bluff Bar, C. and/or C. Schultz (as named in the complaint) and NO CONTACT with Co-defendants-Jeff Scruton, Luke Scruton, and/or David DeBlare.
Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: 14CF58 & any other existing sentence.

records.addlTxt: 14CF58 & 14CF83-cases called at 2:43 pm. Defendant David D. Cole in court with attorney John H. Wallace.  Steven P. Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached. Preliminary hearing addressed. Defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing in 14CF83.  Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of right to preliminary hearing, finds probable cause and enters an order binding defendant over for trial. Information filed.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest to Count 2 in 14CF58. No Contest to Count 2 in 14CF83. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses repeater enhancer on Count 2 of 14CF58. Court dismisses and reads-in Counts 1 & 3 in 14CF58 and Count 1 of 14CF83. Statement by victims. Court sentences the defendant to: 14CF58-10 years WSP to be served as: 5 years IC & 5 years ES. Credit of 200 days. 14CF83-10 years WSP to be served as: 5 years IC & 5 years ES. Credit for 200 days.  Concurrent to each other and concurrent to any other sentence currently existing. CONDITIONS OF ES: Restitution in the amount of $2,168.81 ($1698.18 to Jorgies & $470.63 to the Bluff). Joint and Several. Civil judgment if revoked.  Costs to be paid within 60 days. Court directs 25% of prison earnings. No Contact with The Bluff Bar and/or Jorgie's. No Contact with C. or C. Schultz.. No contact with Jeff Scruton, Luke Scruton, and/or David DeBlare.  Absolute sobriety, No bars, no possession or ingestion of any controlled substances without a valid prescription from a treating physician. Terms of Agent. Not eligible for CIP but Eligible for SAP. Appeal Rights Given.
Petition and Order for Writ of Habeas Corpus ad Prosequendum

Status conference on September 10, 2014 at 02:05 pm.

14CF58 & 14CF83 Cases called @ 2:46 p.m. Attorney John H. Wallace in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.The court previously entered dismissal as to 14CF83 due to an untimely filing of the information. DA Blader has filed a letter advising that there was not an untimely filing of the information because there was a waiver of only the time limits for the preliminary hearing not the hearing itself in 14CF83. The court based on that information will vacate the dismissal previously entered in 14CF83.  Status conference scheduled for September 10, 2014 at 02:05 pm.
Status conference on July 31, 2014 at 03:15 pm.
from DA Blader Re: Dismissal Order entered 7/16/2014

14CF-58 and 14CF-83 - Both Case Called @ 2:08 PM:   Defendant David D. Cole in court with Attorney John H. Wallace.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court:  Dismisses w/o prejudice 14CF-83 - no personal jurisdiction due to non filing of INFO w/in 30 days time period.  Dismissal is without prejudice and may be refiled.  Anticipated that new action will be filed forthwith.  14CF-58 Court will amend bond to $4000.00 cash and applies prior bond of $2000.00 as partial payment.  Per Atty Wallace:  Defendant requests bond be revoked and he would like to turn himself in today.  Statement by Def as to bond.  State takes no position on bond in light of unusual circumstances.  Court reviews appropriate statute regarding surety (s. 961.14).  Defendant remanded into custody, according to his wishes.  Considers the application for relief of the bond by the surety once properly submitted for return of bond.  Atty Wallace submits surety letter.  Court:  $4000 cash bond to remain in place as now ordered as to 14CF-58.
State's
John Wallace
Status conference on July 16, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

CASH BOND ORDERED AS TO BOTH WAUSHARA CO CASE NOS. 2014CF000058 AND 2014CF000083.  Defendant is prohibited from engaging in any commerce via the Internet or any pawning of merchandise through buy, sell or trade.    Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. No possession of any firearms.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 3:12 PM: Defendant David D. Cole in court with attorney John H Wallace.  Scott C Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per Atty Wallace - pre-lim to be waived today.  Court entertains waiver of pre-lim hearing as to 14CF-58.  Court accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of pre-lim hearing.  Def BOT.  ARGN to be scheduled and to track with 14CF-83.  14CF-83:  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.  Court entertains waiver of time limits for pre-lim hearing.  Court accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of 10 day time limit.  DA argues as to bond and requests one bond be ordered as to both cases.  New matter is ordered subject to bond already ordered in 14CF- 58 - one bond for both cases with same conditions.  DA states that it is believed that other jurisdictions also filing new charges most notably Winnebago/Waupaca - pending in Outagamie.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State as to 14CF83.  Status conference scheduled for July 16, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
